If less than forty (40) hours is worked in the calendar week, missed hours on the initial schedule will be paid but only to the extent that straight time hours on the new schedule in the calendar week plus hours worked on the old schedule in the calendar week plus missed hours on the initial schedule does not exceed forty (40).
summary: If a change between CWW schedules causes an employee to lose scheduled work hours, they will be paid for those lost hours, but only up to a maximum of 40 total straight-time hours for that week (including hours already worked and paid lost hours).
logical_representation: IF lost_hours_due_to_shift_change (llm) > 0 AND weekly_hours < 40 -> PAY(MIN(lost_hours_due_to_shift_change (llm), 40 - weekly_hours)) AT ST
reasoning: This rule provides a mechanism for compensating employees for scheduled time they were unable to work due to an employer's action, ensuring a minimum weekly pay. This is a form of guaranteed time and falls under labor worked time.

name: Overtime, 5x8 Schedule, Weekday
rule_text: Monday: 8 hours Straight Time, Up to 2 hours TimeandOneHalf (1.5x), After 10 hours DoubleTime (2x)
summary: On a 5x8 schedule (Monday-Friday), the first 8 hours are paid at straight time, the next 2 hours (hours 9 and 10) are at time-and-a-half, and any hours worked beyond 10 are at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '5x8' AND day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'] -> PAY(daily_hours <= 8 at ST) AND PAY(daily_hours > 8 AND daily_hours <= 10 at 1.5x) AND PAY(daily_hours > 10 at 2.0x)
reasoning: This rule provides a clear, tiered structure for calculating daily overtime for a standard work schedule, which is a fundamental aspect of categorizing worked hours.

name: Overtime, 5x8 Schedule, Saturday/Sunday/Stat Holiday
rule_text:
Saturday: All hours DoubleTime (2x)
Sunday: All hours DoubleTime (2x)
Stat Holiday: All hours DoubleTime (2x)
summary: On a 5x8 schedule, all hours worked on a Saturday, Sunday, or Statutory Holiday are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '5x8' AND (day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN'] OR is_stat_holiday == true) -> PREMIUM(2.0)
reasoning: This rule defines the pay rate for specific days of the week and holidays on a standard schedule, which is a core component of processing worked time.

name: Overtime, 4x10 Mon-Thu Schedule, Regular Day
rule_text: Monday-Thursday: 10 hours Straight Time, After 10 hours Double Time (2x)
summary: On a 4x10 Monday-Thursday schedule, the first 10 hours worked on a regular workday (Mon-Thu) are paid at straight time, and any hours beyond 10 are at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_mon_thu' AND day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU'] -> PAY(daily_hours <= 10 at ST) AND PAY(daily_hours > 10 at 2.0x)
reasoning: This rule defines the daily overtime threshold and rate for a specific compressed work week schedule, a key function in categorizing worked hours.

name: Overtime, 4x10 Mon-Thu Schedule, Friday
rule_text: Friday: Up to 10 hours Time and One Half (1.5x), After 10 hours Double Time (2x)
summary: On a 4x10 Monday-Thursday schedule, all hours worked on a Friday (a scheduled day off) are paid as overtime: the first 10 hours at time-and-a-half, and any hours beyond 10 at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_mon_thu' AND day_of_week == 'FRI' -> PAY(daily_hours <= 10 at 1.5x) AND PAY(daily_hours > 10 at 2.0x)
reasoning: This rule provides a tiered overtime structure for working on a scheduled day off within a specific schedule, which is a core rule for labor time calculation.

name: Overtime, 4x10 Mon-Thu Schedule, Sat/Sun/Stat
rule_text:
Saturday: All hours Double Time (2x)
Sunday: All hours Double Time (2x)
Stat Holiday: All hours Double Time (2x)
summary: On a 4x10 Monday-Thursday schedule, all hours worked on a Saturday, Sunday, or Statutory Holiday are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_mon_thu' AND (day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN'] OR is_stat_holiday == true) -> PREMIUM(2.0)
reasoning: This rule defines the pay rate for specific days of the week and holidays on a compressed work week schedule, a core component of processing worked time.

name: Overtime, 4x10 Tue-Fri Schedule, Regular Day
rule_text: Tuesday-Friday: 10 hours Straight Time, After 10 hours Double Time (2x)
summary: On a 4x10 Tuesday-Friday schedule, the first 10 hours worked on a regular workday (Tue-Fri) are paid at straight time, and any hours beyond 10 are at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_tue_fri' AND day_of_week IN ['TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'] -> PAY(daily_hours <= 10 at ST) AND PAY(daily_hours > 10 at 2.0x)
reasoning: This rule defines the daily overtime threshold and rate for a specific compressed work week schedule, a key function in categorizing worked hours.

name: Overtime, 4x10 Tue-Fri Schedule, Monday
rule_text: Monday: Up to 10 hours Time and One Half (1.5x), After 10 hours Double Time (2x)
summary: On a 4x10 Tuesday-Friday schedule, all hours worked on a Monday (a scheduled day off) are paid as overtime: the first 10 hours at time-and-a-half, and any hours beyond 10 at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_tue_fri' AND day_of_week == 'MON' -> PAY(daily_hours <= 10 at 1.5x) AND PAY(daily_hours > 10 at 2.0x)
reasoning: This rule provides a tiered overtime structure for working on a scheduled day off within a specific schedule, which is a core rule for labor time calculation.

name: Overtime, 4x10 Tue-Fri Schedule, Sat/Sun/Stat
rule_text:
Saturday: All hours Double Time (2x)
Sunday: All hours Double Time (2x)
Stat Holiday: All hours Double Time (2x)
summary: On a 4x10 Tuesday-Friday schedule, all hours worked on a Saturday, Sunday, or Statutory Holiday are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_tue_fri' AND (day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN'] OR is_stat_holiday == true) -> PREMIUM(2.0)
reasoning: This rule defines the pay rate for specific days of the week and holidays on a compressed work week schedule, a core component of processing worked time.

name: CF Industries SDO Schedule Definition
rule_text: The schedule for regular core maintenance activities will operate on an 8-9-9-8-8 rotation on a Monday to Friday basis. Employees will be paid in full for all hours worked each week. (For example, if someone completes the regular 8-9-9-8-8 schedule, they will be compensated for forty-two (42) hours at the regular straight time hourly rate...
summary: At CF Industries, core maintenance employees work a special 8-9-9-8-8 hour schedule from Monday to Friday. Completing this schedule results in 42 hours of pay at the straight time rate for the week.
logical_representation: IF project_location (Unsupported) == 'CF Industries' -> SET(schedule_type='8-9-9-8-8') AND PAY(42_hours_ST_per_week)
reasoning: This rule defines a unique, location-specific work schedule and its corresponding weekly straight time hours, which is a foundational element for all subsequent time calculations for employees on this schedule.

name: CF Industries SDO Schedule Overtime
rule_text: The first two hours of overtime on the 8-9-9-8-8 will be compensated at time and one half (1 ½).
summary: On the special 8-9-9-8-8 schedule at CF Industries, the first two hours of overtime worked are paid at time-and-a-half.
logical_representation: IF project_location (Unsupported) == 'CF Industries' AND schedule_type == '8-9-9-8-8' -> PAY(weekly_overtime_hours (llm) <= 2 at 1.5x)
reasoning: This rule specifies the overtime rate for a unique work schedule, which is a core function of categorizing and calculating pay for worked hours.

name: Weekly Payday Schedule
rule_text: Wages will be paid weekly by cheque or other legal tender by the end of the work day on Thursday.
summary: Employees are paid on a weekly basis, with payment issued by the end of the workday on Thursday.
logical_representation: IF pay_frequency (llm) == 'WEEKLY' -> PAY_DISTRIBUTION(BY_END_OF_DAY, THU)
reasoning: This rule defines the timing and frequency of wage payments, a fundamental aspect of the payment for labor.

name: Second Shift Payday
rule_text: If there is a second shift the weekly cheques will be distributed by the end of the work day Wednesday if available on site.
summary: For employees working a second shift, weekly paycheques will be distributed by the end of the day on Wednesday, if the cheques are available on site.
logical_representation: IF shift_type == 'NIGHT' AND pay_availability (llm) == 'ON_SITE' -> PAY_DISTRIBUTION(BY_END_OF_DAY, WED)
reasoning: This is a variation on the standard payday rule based on an employee's shift, affecting the timing of wage distribution.

name: Foreperson Premium, ICCS Designation
rule_text: General Forepersons and Forepersons who have achieved the status of Industrial Construction Crew Supervisor designation from the Alberta Apprenticeship Industry Training will receive an additional one dollar and fifty cents ($1.50) over the regular General Forepersons and Forepersons rates (for all hours worked) contained in the applicable reference agreement.
summary: General Forepersons and Forepersons with an Industrial Construction Crew Supervisor (ICCS) designation receive a premium of $1.50 for all hours worked.
logical_representation: IF is_foreman == true AND certification_status (llm) == 'ICCS' -> PREMIUM($1.50)
reasoning: This is a direct wage premium based on a worker's role and certification, which is a component of their pay calculation for hours worked.

name: Foreperson Premium, No Pyramiding
rule_text: The premium is not to be pyramided.
summary: The $1.50 premium for Forepersons with an ICCS designation cannot be compounded with other premiums (pyramided).
logical_representation: IF is_foreman == true AND certification_status (llm) == 'ICCS' -> CONSTRAINT(NO_PYRAMIDING_ON_PREMIUM)
reasoning: This is a calculation rule that constrains how a wage premium is applied, directly affecting the final pay for worked time.

name: Benefit Fund Contributions
rule_text:
Employers will make appropriate contributions to the following funds for those participating trades which  have  the  provision  contained  within  their  respective  Industrial  Construction  Reference Agreement:
- o Building Trades of Alberta
- o Audiometric Testing
- o Construction Employee Family Assistance Program (CEFAP)
- o Case Managed Aftercare (CMAC)
- o Rapid Site Access Program (RSAP)
- o Workforce Development Trust Fund (WFDT)
summary: Employers must contribute to specified funds (e.g., Building Trades of Alberta, CEFAP) for trades where such contributions are required by their Industrial Construction Reference Agreement.
logical_representation: IF base_rate_source (llm) REQUIRES_FUND_CONTRIBUTIONS -> PAY(FUND_CONTRIBUTIONS)
reasoning: This rule defines employer obligations for monetary contributions tied to employment, which are part of the overall compensation package alongside direct wages.

name: Retroactive Pay for Renewals
rule_text: Payment of any initial increase will be paid retroactively to the implementation date.
summary: Any initial pay increases resulting from a renewed agreement must be paid retroactively to the effective date of the new agreement.
logical_representation: PAY(INITIAL_INCREASE) -> RETROACTIVE_TO(validity_start_date)
reasoning: This rule dictates how pay increases are calculated and applied over a past period, directly impacting an employee's total earnings.

name: Alloy Welder Premium, Dispatch Requirement
rule_text: Alloy welders with a valid alloy welding certificate will be paid an additional premium of three dollars and twenty-five cents ($3.25) per hour worked if certification was a requirement for dispatch.
summary: A premium of $3.25 per hour is paid to alloy welders with a valid certificate, provided that the certification was a requirement for their dispatch to the job.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'ALLOY_WELDER' AND certification_status (llm) == 'VALID_ALLOY_WELDING' AND dispatch_requirement (llm) == true -> PREMIUM($3.25)
reasoning: This rule establishes a specific wage premium based on trade, certification, and dispatch conditions, a direct calculation for pay.

name: Re-classification to Alloy Welder On Site
rule_text: If a welder on site who was not dispatched as an alloy welder, but has the certification, or is requested to  be  certified  by  the  employer  and  is  requested  to  perform  alloy  welding,  the  worker  will  be  reclassified as an alloy welder and paid the alloy welder premium from the date of re-classification.
summary: If a welder on site is asked to perform alloy welding and has or obtains the required certification, they will be reclassified as an alloy welder and receive the corresponding premium from that date forward.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'WELDER' AND work_task (llm) == 'ALLOY_WELDING' AND certification_status (llm) == 'VALID_ALLOY_WELDING' -> RECLASSIFY('ALLOY_WELDER') AND PAY(PREMIUM($3.25))
reasoning: This rule governs a change in an employee's classification and pay rate based on the work they are assigned, directly impacting their compensation for time worked.

name: Alloy Welder Premium, No Overtime Pyramiding
rule_text: This premium shall not pyramid on an overtime hour; however, it will attract applicable Vacation and Statutory Holiday Pay.
summary: The alloy welder premium is a flat hourly addition, is not multiplied by any overtime rate, but is included when calculating vacation and statutory holiday pay.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'ALLOY_WELDER' -> CONSTRAINT(PREMIUM_NOT_PYRAMIDED_ON_OT) AND INCLUDE_PREMIUM_IN_VACATION_AND_STAT_PAY_CALCULATION
reasoning: This rule specifies calculation mechanics for a premium, detailing how it interacts with overtime and other pay components, which is a core part of pay calculation.

name: List of Recognized Statutory Holidays
rule_text: 11.100 The following days will constitute the recognized holidays within the terms of this Agreement. ... 1. New Years Day 2. Family Day 3. Good Friday 4. Victoria Day 5. Canada Day 6. Civic Holiday 7. Labour Day 8. National Day for Truth & Reconciliation 9. Thanksgiving Day 10. Remembrance Day 11. Christmas Day 12. Boxing Day
summary: The agreement specifies twelve official statutory holidays, including New Year's Day, Family Day, and Christmas Day.
logical_representation: is_stat_holiday == true IF date IN ('New Years Day', 'Family Day', 'Good Friday', 'Victoria Day', 'Canada Day', 'Civic Holiday', 'Labour Day', 'National Day for Truth & Reconciliation', 'Thanksgiving Day', 'Remembrance Day', 'Christmas Day', 'Boxing Day')
reasoning: This rule defines which days are classified as statutory holidays, which directly impacts how labor time is categorized and paid on those days.

name: Automatic Recognition of New Government Holidays
rule_text: Any other holiday proclaimed by either the Provincial or Federal Government will be automatically recognized within this Agreement.
summary: If the Provincial or Federal Government declares a new public holiday, it will be automatically added to the list of recognized holidays under this agreement.
logical_representation: IF is_government_proclaimed_holiday (llm) == true -> SET(is_stat_holiday, true)
reasoning: This rule expands the definition of a statutory holiday based on external government proclamations, which affects pay rules for worked time on those days.

name: Default Holiday Observance on Calendar Date
rule_text: Each of the recognized holidays listed in Article 12.100 shall be observed on the calendar day on which it occurs.
summary: Recognized statutory holidays are to be observed on their actual calendar date, unless specified otherwise.
logical_representation: DEFAULT(holiday_observance_date (llm) == calendar_date)
reasoning: This rule establishes the default timing for when statutory holiday pay rules apply, which is fundamental to calculating worked time and pay.

name: Moving Specific Holidays into Work Week
rule_text: When any of these three identified holidays: Family Day, Victoria Day, Labour Day fall outside of the regularly scheduled work week, they will be moved into the work week for observance.
summary: If Family Day, Victoria Day, or Labour Day falls on a weekend or a non-scheduled workday, the day of observance will be moved to a day within the regular work week.
logical_representation: IF holiday_name (llm) IN ('Family Day', 'Victoria Day', 'Labour Day') AND is_regularly_scheduled_work_day (llm) == false -> MOVE(holiday_observance_date (llm), to_work_week)
reasoning: This rule alters the date on which statutory holiday pay rules are applied for specific holidays, directly affecting the categorization of worked time.

name: Holiday Observance Pay vs Day Off Option
rule_text: On the day of observance, the Company may either pay the workforce at double-time (2) the total package straight time hourly rate or provide the day off.
summary: On a statutory holiday, the company has the choice to either pay employees double-time for working or give them the day off.
logical_representation: IF is_stat_holiday == true -> OPTION(PAY(2.0), PROVIDE(day_off))
reasoning: This rule defines the compensation for a statutory holiday, offering a choice between a premium pay rate for working or a day off. This is a core component of labor worked time rules.

name: Holiday Harmonization for Maintenance Workers
rule_text: On maintenance, the overriding factor is harmonizing statutory holidays with in-plant workers. Should the Owner determine another day be recognized for its people, this day will be recognized by Company forces.
summary: For maintenance work, if the site owner observes a statutory holiday on a different day than the agreement, the company's maintenance workers will also observe the holiday on the owner's chosen day.
logical_representation: IF work_type (llm) == 'maintenance' AND owner_observance_date (llm) != calendar_date -> SET(holiday_observance_date (llm), owner_observance_date (llm))
reasoning: This rule modifies the observance date for a statutory holiday under specific work conditions (maintenance), which directly impacts when special pay rates apply.

name: Holiday Harmonization Trigger Condition
rule_text: The day of observance for the Holiday remains as identified, unless direction has been given by the Client requesting for our employers to observe it at the same time as the in-plant personnel.
summary: The holiday observance date only changes to match the client's date if the client explicitly directs the contractor to do so. A client's internal decision to move their own holiday observance is not enough to trigger this change automatically.
logical_representation: IF is_client_direction_given (llm) == true -> APPLY(harmonization)
reasoning: This rule defines the specific condition (client direction) required to alter the statutory holiday observance date, which is crucial for determining the correct day for special pay calculations.

name: Harmonization Notification to GPMC
rule_text: In order for the harmonization principle to be applicable, the Contractor must notify the GPMC in advance of the pending movement of the Holiday along with the designated day for observance.
summary: To change the observance date of a holiday to match a client's schedule, the contractor is required to provide advance notification to the GPMC about the change and the new date.
logical_representation: IF is_gpmc_notified (llm) == false -> FORFEIT(harmonization)
reasoning: This rule establishes a procedural prerequisite for changing a statutory holiday's observance date. Failure to comply affects which day is treated as the holiday for pay purposes.

name: Harmonization Facility-Wide Application
rule_text: The designated day to for observance must be applicable to all contractors and all trades across the entire facility.
summary: If a statutory holiday observance date is changed to match a client's schedule, the new date must apply uniformly to all contractors and all trades working at that facility.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(is_harmonization_facility_wide (llm) == true)
reasoning: This rule sets a condition for the validity of a changed holiday observance date, ensuring consistency in how worked time is treated across a site, which is a core aspect of labor time rules.

name: Holiday Observance Posting Deadline
rule_text: Employers will post the date to be observed no later than seven (7) days prior to the holiday.
summary: Employers must inform employees of the date a statutory holiday will be observed at least seven days in advance.
logical_representation: IF days_prior_to_holiday (llm) >= 7 -> REQUIRE(post_holiday_observance_date)
reasoning: This rule is a procedural requirement related to statutory holidays, ensuring workers are aware of which day will be subject to special pay rules. It's related to the administration of worked time.

name: Default Observance on Harmonization Failure
rule_text: In the absence of meeting the above and providing proper notification, the holiday will be observed in accordance with the provisions outlined in Article 12.000.
summary: If the conditions for changing a holiday's observance date (harmonization) are not met, the holiday will be observed on its standard, pre-defined date.
logical_representation: IF is_harmonization_conditions_met (llm) == false -> APPLY(default_holiday_observance)
reasoning: This rule specifies the fallback for determining the statutory holiday observance date, which is essential for correctly applying holiday pay rates to worked time.

name: Minimum Reporting Pay (Show-Up Time)
rule_text: When an employee reports for work, unless previously advised there is no work available, they shall be entitled to two (2) hours pay at the appropriate day or shift rate.
summary: If an employee shows up for a scheduled shift and was not told beforehand that there's no work, they are guaranteed a minimum of two hours of pay at their regular rate for that shift.
logical_representation: IF prior_notification_of_no_work (llm) == false -> MIN_PAY(2_HOURS)
reasoning: This rule establishes a minimum payment guarantee for employees who report to work, which is a fundamental aspect of calculating worked time and compensation.

name: Pay for Time Worked or Waited Beyond Reporting Minimum
rule_text: Should the employee start work or be required to wait at the jobsite, they shall be paid for hours worked or actual waiting time past the two (2) hours minimum.
summary: If an employee starts working or is required to wait at the job site, their pay is based on the actual time they spent working or waiting, but it will not be less than the two-hour minimum reporting pay.
logical_representation: IF work_commenced (Unsupported) == true OR waiting_time_hours (llm) > 0 -> PAY(MAX(2_HOURS, daily_hours + waiting_time_hours (llm)))
reasoning: This rule clarifies how to calculate payment when work is performed or time is spent waiting, ensuring the total compensation respects the two-hour minimum. It is a calculation rule for worked time.

name: Initial and Terminal Travel 120-200km
rule_text: As of May 4, 2025, Initial and terminal travel which will be paid as follows from the above: 120-200 Radius Kilometers $ 116.00 each way
summary: Effective May 4, 2025, for projects between 120 and 200 radius kilometers away, employees will receive $116.00 for travel to the job at the start (initial) and for travel from the job at the end (terminal).
logical_representation: IF validity_start_date >= '2025-05-04' AND ((project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) >= 120 AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) <= 200) OR (project_distance_from_hiring_hall (Unsupported) >= 120 AND project_distance_from_hiring_hall (Unsupported) <= 200)) -> ALLOWANCE(116.00_each_way)
reasoning: This rule defines a specific monetary travel allowance, which is a component of subsistence benefits.

name: Initial and Terminal Travel 200-300km
rule_text: As of May 4, 2025, Initial and terminal travel which will be paid as follows from the above: 200-300 Radius Kilometers $ 166.00 each way
summary: Effective May 4, 2025, for projects between 200 and 300 radius kilometers away, employees will receive $166.00 for travel to the job at the start (initial) and for travel from the job at the end (terminal).
logical_representation: IF validity_start_date >= '2025-05-04' AND ((project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) > 200 AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) <= 300) OR (project_distance_from_hiring_hall (Unsupported) > 200 AND project_distance_from_hiring_hall (Unsupported) <= 300)) -> ALLOWANCE(166.00_each_way)
reasoning: This rule defines a specific monetary travel allowance, which is a component of subsistence benefits.

name: Initial and Terminal Travel Beyond 475km
rule_text: As of May 4, 2025, on jobs beyond the four hundred and seventy-five (475) radius kilometers initial and terminal travel amounts will be mutually agreed between the Union and the Employer to a maximum of $455.00 each way or airfare if suitable proof of air transport is provided to the Employer.
summary: Effective May 4, 2025, for jobs over 475 radius kilometers away, initial and terminal travel pay will be a mutually agreed amount up to $455 each way. Alternatively, the company will pay for airfare if proof of air travel is provided.
logical_representation: IF validity_start_date >= '2025-05-04' AND (project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) > 475 OR project_distance_from_hiring_hall (Unsupported) > 475) -> PAY(mutually_agreed_amount_max_455_each_way) OR IF travel_mode (llm) == 'air' AND proof_provided (llm) == true -> PAY(airfare)
reasoning: This rule defines the travel allowance for very remote projects, a key aspect of subsistence benefits.

name: Standard Work Week, 5x8 Schedule
rule_text: Eight (8) hours per day shall constitute a day's work and forty (40) hours per week, Monday to Friday inclusive, shall constitute a week's work.
summary: The standard work schedule is defined as an 8-hour day and a 40-hour week, running from Monday to Friday.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '5x8' AND day_of_week IN ('MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI') -> SET(daily_hours=8, weekly_hours=40)
reasoning: This rule defines the standard hours for a work day and work week, which is fundamental to how worked time is categorized and paid. It's a core definition for labor time.

name: Standard Work Day Start and Quit Times
rule_text: The regular starting time shall be eight (8) o'clock a.m., and the regular quitting time shall be four-thirty (4:30) o'clock p.m.
summary: For a standard workday, the regular start time is 8:00 AM and the regular end time is 4:30 PM.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '5x8' -> SET(start_time='08:00', end_time='16:30')
reasoning: This rule establishes the specific hours of the standard workday, directly relating to the tracking and classification of worked time.

name: Optional 4x10 Work Week
rule_text: As an option, ten (10) hours per day, Monday to Thursday or Tuesday to Friday may be worked at straight time.
summary: An optional 4-day, 10-hour/day work week can be implemented, running either Monday-Thursday or Tuesday-Friday, with all 10 hours paid at straight time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type IN ('4x10_mon_thu', '4x10_tue_fri') AND daily_hours <= 10 -> PAY(ST)
reasoning: This rule defines an alternative standard work schedule, specifying the hours per day and days per week that constitute straight time, a core aspect of labor time categorization.

name: Establishing 4x10 Schedule Minimum Duration
rule_text: The ten (10) hour system must operate for a minimum period of four (4) consecutive days before it is established as the regular hours of work.
summary: To officially establish a 10-hour day system as the regular schedule, it must be worked for at least four consecutive days.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10' AND shift_consecutive_days >= 4 -> SET(schedule_type='4x10_established')
reasoning: This rule sets a condition for when a work schedule becomes official, which governs how pay rules are applied. It's a procedural rule for establishing how time is categorized.

name: 4x10 Schedule Notification
rule_text: When establishing a four (4) day ten (10) hour work week, the Employer will advise the affected Local Union office that a four (4) day ten (10) hour option is in place and declare if it is a Monday to Thursday, or Tuesday to Friday work pattern.
summary: When a 4-day, 10-hour work week is established, the employer must inform the local union and specify whether the schedule is Monday-Thursday or Tuesday-Friday.
logical_representation: IF ESTABLISH(schedule_type='4x10') -> NOTIFY(union_local (Unsupported), schedule_type)
reasoning: This is a procedural rule directly related to the implementation of a specific work schedule, which dictates pay rules. It falls under the administration of worked time.

name: Short Term Work on 4x10 Project
rule_text: Where a multi trade project is scheduled under the four (4) ten (10) hour shift system and an Employer secures short term work that may not provide for forty (40) hours of work, all hours worked shall be paid for in keeping with the provisions applicable to the four (4) ten (10) hour shift.
summary: If short-term work (less than 40 hours) is secured on a project already using a 4-day, 10-hour schedule, the hours worked are still paid according to the 4x10 rules.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10' AND is_short_term_work (llm) == true AND weekly_hours < 40 -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('4x10')
reasoning: This rule clarifies how pay is calculated under a specific schedule (4x10) even when the full weekly hours are not met, ensuring the correct categorization of worked time.

name: Paid Breaks on 10-Hour Shifts
rule_text: When ten (10) hour shifts are worked, in lieu of the work breaks and lunch breaks provided herein, the Employer shall have the option of scheduling two breaks of one half (½) hour each, paid at the applicable rate, approximately equally spaced in the ten (10) hour shift.
summary: On 10-hour shifts, the employer can choose to provide two paid 30-minute breaks instead of the usual breaks, spaced evenly throughout the shift.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours == 10 AND schedule_type LIKE '4x10%' -> PROVIDE(2 x 30_min_paid_breaks)
reasoning: This rule defines an entitlement to paid breaks, which are a component of the total paid hours for a workday. It directly impacts the calculation of labor time and pay.

name: Day Shift Definition
rule_text: Employees working a day shift defined as a shift starting at 8:00 a.m. shall work eight (8) hours for eight (8) hours pay.
summary: A day shift is defined as starting at 8:00 AM, where employees work eight hours and are paid for eight hours.
logical_representation: IF shift_start_time == '08:00' -> SET(shift_type='DAY') AND PAY(8_hours) FOR WORK(8_hours)
reasoning: This rule defines a specific shift type ('DAY') and its standard duration and pay, which is fundamental to categorizing hours worked.

name: Shift Premium
rule_text: Employees working any shift that is outside of daywork conditions, shall receive a shift premium of four dollars and fifty cents ($4.50) per hour worked.
summary: A premium of $4.50 per hour is paid for all hours worked on any shift that is not considered a standard day shift.
logical_representation: IF shift_type != 'DAY' -> PREMIUM($4.50)
reasoning: This rule establishes a premium payment based on the timing of the work (shift type). This is a core component of how labor time is valued and paid.

name: Overtime, 5x8 Schedule, Daily
rule_text:
Five Eight Hour Days (5x8)
Monday-Friday:
Straight Time: 8 hours
Time and One Half (1.5x): Up to 2 hours
Double Time (2x): After 10 hours
summary: On a standard 5-day, 8-hour week, overtime from Monday to Friday is paid at time-and-a-half for the first 2 hours after 8 hours, and double time for all hours worked beyond 10.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '5x8' AND day_of_week IN ('MON','TUE','WED','THU','FRI') -> PAY(daily_hours<=8, ST) AND PAY(daily_hours>8 AND daily_hours<=10, OT) AND PAY(daily_hours>10, DT)
reasoning: This rule explicitly defines the thresholds for straight time, time-and-a-half, and double time on a specific schedule, which is the primary function of the LABOR_WORKED_TIME topic.

name: Overtime, 5x8 Schedule, Weekend and Holiday
rule_text:
Five Eight Hour Days (5x8)
Saturday: All hours Double Time (2x)
Sunday: All hours Double Time (2x)
Stat Holiday: All hours Double Time (2x)
summary: On a standard 5-day, 8-hour week, all hours worked on Saturday, Sunday, or a Statutory Holiday are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '5x8' AND (day_of_week IN ('SAT', 'SUN') OR is_stat_holiday == true) -> PAY(ALL_HOURS, DT)
reasoning: This rule defines the pay rate for specific days of the week and holidays, which is a core component of categorizing and calculating pay for worked time.

name: Overtime, 4x10 Mon-Thu Schedule, Weekdays
rule_text:
Four Ten Hour Day Option (4x10) Monday to Thursday:
Monday-Thursday: 10 hours Straight Time, After 10 hours Double Time (2x)
Friday: Up to 10 hours Time and One Half (1.5x), After 10 hours Double Time (2x)
summary: On a 4x10 Monday-Thursday schedule: Mon-Thu hours are straight time up to 10, then double time. All hours worked on Friday are time-and-a-half for the first 10 hours, and double time thereafter.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_mon_thu' -> (IF day_of_week IN ('MON','TUE','WED','THU') -> PAY(daily_hours<=10, ST) AND PAY(daily_hours>10, DT)) AND (IF day_of_week == 'FRI' -> PAY(daily_hours<=10, OT) AND PAY(daily_hours>10, DT))
reasoning: This rule details the specific overtime thresholds and pay rates for weekdays on a 4x10 Monday-Thursday schedule, directly addressing the categorization of worked time.

name: Overtime, 4x10 Mon-Thu Schedule, Weekend and Holiday
rule_text:
Four Ten Hour Day Option (4x10) Monday to Thursday:
Saturday: All hours Double Time (2x)
Sunday: All hours Double Time (2x)
Stat Holiday: All hours Double Time (2x)
summary: On a 4x10 Monday-Thursday schedule, all hours worked on Saturday, Sunday, or a Statutory Holiday are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_mon_thu' AND (day_of_week IN ('SAT', 'SUN') OR is_stat_holiday == true) -> PAY(ALL_HOURS, DT)
reasoning: This rule specifies the pay rates for non-standard workdays (weekends, holidays) on a specific schedule, which is a key part of classifying worked time.

name: Overtime, 4x10 Tue-Fri Schedule, Weekdays
rule_text:
Four Ten Hour Day Option (4x10) Tuesday to Friday:
Monday: Up to 10 hours Time and One Half (1.5x), After 10 hours Double Time (2x)
Tuesday-Friday: 10 hours Straight Time, After 10 hours Double Time (2x)
summary: On a 4x10 Tuesday-Friday schedule: all hours worked on Monday are time-and-a-half for the first 10 hours, then double time. Tue-Fri hours are straight time up to 10, and double time thereafter.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_tue_fri' -> (IF day_of_week == 'MON' -> PAY(daily_hours<=10, OT) AND PAY(daily_hours>10, DT)) AND (IF day_of_week IN ('TUE','WED','THU','FRI') -> PAY(daily_hours<=10, ST) AND PAY(daily_hours>10, DT))
reasoning: This rule details the specific overtime thresholds and pay rates for weekdays on a 4x10 Tuesday-Friday schedule, directly addressing the categorization of worked time.

name: Overtime, 4x10 Tue-Fri Schedule, Weekend and Holiday
rule_text:
Four Ten Hour Day Option (4x10) Tuesday to Friday:
Saturday: All hours Double Time (2x)
Sunday: All hours Double Time (2x)
Stat Holiday: All hours Double Time (2x)
summary: On a 4x10 Tuesday-Friday schedule, all hours worked on Saturday, Sunday, or a Statutory Holiday are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_tue_fri' AND (day_of_week IN ('SAT', 'SUN') OR is_stat_holiday == true) -> PAY(ALL_HOURS, DT)
reasoning: This rule specifies the pay rates for non-standard workdays (weekends, holidays) on a specific schedule, which is a key part of classifying worked time.

name: Overtime Meal Break Entitlement, Daily
rule_text: When an employee works beyond ten (10) hours per day they shall be entitled to a meal break and a meal supplied by the Company. The meal break will be provided after ten (10) hours of work and subsequent meal breaks each four (4) hours thereafter.
summary: An employee is entitled to a company-provided meal and a meal break after working more than 10 hours in a day. Additional meal breaks are provided every 4 hours after that.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours > 10 -> PROVIDE(meal_and_break) AND IF (daily_hours - 10) % 4 == 0 -> PROVIDE(meal_and_break)
reasoning: This rule establishes the conditions (hours worked) under which an employee is entitled to a meal and break, which is the core definition of the LABOR_MEAL_ALLOWANCE topic.

name: Overtime Meal Break Exception, 4x10 Schedule
rule_text: When the four (4) ten (10) hour day option is worked, recognizing emergency situations will arise, if the Company has not scheduled in excess of the ten (10) hour shift, the Company shall be granted a one (1) hour extension where a meal and meal break are not required.
summary: On a 4x10 schedule, if overtime is unscheduled and due to an emergency, the company can extend the shift by one hour (to 11 hours) before a meal and break are required.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type LIKE '4x10%' AND is_emergency (llm) == true AND is_scheduled_overtime (llm) == false AND daily_hours > 10 AND daily_hours <= 11 -> FORFEIT(meal_and_break)
reasoning: This rule creates a specific exception to the standard meal entitlement rule based on the work schedule and situation. It modifies the conditions for receiving a meal allowance.

name: Overtime Meal Break, Scheduled Overtime
rule_text: When an employee works Scheduled Overtime (work performed on Saturdays, Sundays and Holidays they shall be entitled to a meal break when overtime work exceeds ten (10) hours.
summary: During scheduled overtime on weekends or holidays, a meal break is provided after working more than 10 hours.
logical_representation: IF is_scheduled_overtime (llm) == true AND daily_overtime_hours > 10 -> PROVIDE(meal_break)
reasoning: This rule defines the trigger (10 hours of scheduled overtime) for a meal break entitlement, which falls squarely under the LABOR_MEAL_ALLOWANCE topic.

name: Overtime Meal Break, Call-Out
rule_text: When an employee works Short Notice Emergency Call-Out Overtime (overtime work performed other than continuous with the regular work day or Scheduled Overtime) they shall be entitled to a meal break when overtime work exceeds four (4) hours.
summary: For emergency call-out overtime that is not continuous with a regular shift, a meal break is provided after working more than 4 hours.
logical_representation: IF is_call_out (llm) == true AND daily_overtime_hours > 4 -> PROVIDE(meal_break)
reasoning: This rule specifies a unique trigger (4 hours on a call-out) for a meal break entitlement, classifying it as a rule for LABOR_MEAL_ALLOWANCE.

name: Overtime Meal Break Details
rule_text: All overtime meal breaks will be thirty (30) minutes in duration and will be paid for at straight time rates. However, in calculating entitlement to a meal, the thirty (30) minute break shall not count as overtime work.
summary: Overtime meal breaks are 30 minutes long and paid at the straight-time rate. This 30-minute break does not count as work time when determining eligibility for subsequent meal breaks.
logical_representation: IF meal_break_triggered == true -> SET(break_duration=30_minutes, break_pay_rate=ST) AND EXCLUDE(break_duration) FROM daily_overtime_hours FOR meal_calculation
reasoning: The primary topic is LABOR_MEAL_ALLOWANCE as it defines the duration and pay for the meal break itself. It has a secondary topic of LABOR_WORKED_TIME because it specifies that this paid time is excluded from the overtime calculation, affecting how subsequent worked time is categorized.

name: Foreman Meal Break Exception
rule_text: When a foreperson is required to: 1) Start up to one (1) hour earlier, or 2) Finish up to one (1) hour later, or 3) Start up to one-half (1/2) hour earlier and finish up to one-half (1/2) hour later than the foreperson's crews... the foreperson shall not be entitled to a meal or meal break as per Clause 16.600 unless those provisions are applicable to the rest of the crew.
summary: A foreman who starts or finishes slightly earlier or later (within specified limits) than their crew for preparatory work is not entitled to an overtime meal unless the rest of the crew also qualifies for one.
logical_representation: IF is_foreman == true AND (start_offset <= 1_hour OR end_offset <= 1_hour OR (start_offset <= 0.5_hour AND end_offset <= 0.5_hour)) AND crew_meal_entitlement (llm) == false -> FORFEIT(meal_and_break)
reasoning: This rule creates a specific exception to meal allowance eligibility based on the employee's role (foreman) and work pattern relative to their crew. This directly modifies meal entitlement.

name: Call-Out Minimum Pay
rule_text: Employees called out between regular shifts will be entitled to a minimum of two (2) hours pay at double (2x) the straight time total package hourly rate.
summary: When an employee is called out to work between their regular shifts, they are guaranteed a minimum of two hours' pay at the double time rate.
logical_representation: IF is_call_out (llm) == true -> PAY(MIN(2_hours), DT)
reasoning: This rule guarantees a minimum number of paid hours at a premium rate for a specific type of work event (call-out). This is a fundamental rule for calculating labor pay and time.

name: Call-Out Pay Beyond Minimum
rule_text: All hours worked beyond the minimum two (2) hour threshold will be paid at double (2x) the straight time total package hourly rate.
summary: For a call-out, all hours worked beyond the guaranteed two-hour minimum are also paid at the double time rate.
logical_representation: IF is_call_out (llm) == true AND daily_hours > 2 -> PAY(daily_hours-2, DT)
reasoning: This rule specifies the pay rate for hours worked during a call-out, continuing from the minimum guarantee. It is a core rule for categorizing and paying for worked time.

name: 12-Hour Turnaround Shift Option
rule_text: Employers may implement a twelve (12) hour shift with three (3) half hour paid breaks for turnaround activities within the province of Alberta.
summary: For turnaround work in Alberta, employers have the option to implement a 12-hour shift schedule that includes three paid 30-minute breaks.
logical_representation: IF activity_type (Unsupported) == 'TURNAROUND' AND project_location (Unsupported) == 'Alberta' -> ALLOW(schedule_type='12_hour_shift')
reasoning: This rule defines a new, optional work schedule, including its duration and paid break structure. This is a foundational rule for how worked time is organized and paid under specific conditions.

name: 12-Hour Shift Pay, 4x10 Base
rule_text: 4 x 10 Monday to Thursday or Tuesday to Friday: 10 hours @ straight time, 2 hours @ doubletime (2x)
summary: When a 12-hour turnaround shift is based on a 4x10 schedule, the pay for each of the first four days is 10 hours at straight time and 2 hours at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '12_hour_shift' AND base_schedule_type (llm) LIKE '4x10%' AND daily_hours == 12 -> PAY(first_10_hours, ST) AND PAY(last_2_hours, DT)
reasoning: This rule explicitly breaks down a 12-hour workday into different pay categories (ST, DT) based on a specific underlying schedule. This is a core function of the LABOR_WORKED_TIME topic.

name: 12-Hour Shift Pay, 5x8 Base
rule_text: 5 x 8 Monday to Friday: 8 hours @ straight time, 2 hours at time and one half (1 ½), 2 hours at doubletime (2x)
summary: When a 12-hour turnaround shift is based on a 5x8 schedule, the pay for each of the first five days is 8 hours at straight time, 2 hours at time-and-a-half, and 2 hours at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '12_hour_shift' AND base_schedule_type (llm) == '5x8' AND daily_hours == 12 -> PAY(first_8_hours, ST) AND PAY(next_2_hours, OT) AND PAY(last_2_hours, DT)
reasoning: This rule explicitly breaks down a 12-hour workday into different pay categories (ST, OT, DT) based on a specific underlying schedule. This is a core function of the LABOR_WORKED_TIME topic.

name: Compressed Work Week Schedule for Long Term Crew
rule_text: The  parties  to  this  Agreement  agree  that  the  maximum  of  nine  (9)  hours  shall constitute  a  normal  days  work  beginning  at  7:30  a.m.  and  ending  at  5:00  p.m. (excluding a one-half hour (1/2) lunch break) may be utilized if restricted to Long Term Base Crew Employees.
summary: For Long Term Base Crew Employees on a Compressed Work Week, a normal workday is nine hours, from 7:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., with a 30-minute unpaid lunch break.
logical_representation: IF employee_category (llm) == 'LONG_TERM_BASE_CREW' -> SET(schedule_type, '5x9') AND SET(daily_hours_ST, 9)
reasoning: This rule defines the standard daily hours and schedule for a specific employee category, which falls under the classification of labor worked time.

name: Compressed Work Week Weekly Hours for Long Term Crew
rule_text: the maximum normal work week shall be forty-five (45) hours beginning Monday at 7:30 a.m. and ending Friday at 5:00 p.m.
summary: For Long Term Base Crew Employees on a Compressed Work Week, the maximum normal work week is forty-five hours, Monday to Friday.
logical_representation: IF employee_category (llm) == 'LONG_TERM_BASE_CREW' AND schedule_type == '5x9' -> SET(weekly_hours_ST, 45)
reasoning: This rule establishes the standard weekly hour threshold before overtime for a specific work schedule, which is a core component of how labor worked time is categorized.

name: Pay for Short Term Employees (9th Hour)
rule_text: It  is  understood  that  when  employees  are  hired  with  the  intentions  of  short-term employment (defined as less than six (6) weeks from the date of hire) that they will be paid in the following manner. During this six (6) week period, employees will be paid time and one-half (1 1/2) for the ninth (9th) hour.
summary: Employees hired for short-term work (less than six weeks) will be paid time and one-half (1.5x) for the ninth hour worked each day.
logical_representation: IF employee_category (llm) == 'SHORT_TERM' AND employee_tenure_weeks (llm) <= 6 AND daily_hours > 8 AND daily_hours <= 9 -> TRANSITION(OT)
reasoning: This rule specifies an overtime condition for a particular category of employee and a specific hour of the day, making it a clear rule about the categorization and payment of labor worked time.

name: Termination Pay Adjustment for Unused Flex EDOs
rule_text: If a long term employee is terminated without having a flex EDO within the previous six (6) weeks, then an adjustment will be made to pay any regular hours worked in excess of two hundred and forty (240) hours over the previous six (6) weeks at the applicable overtime rate.
summary: If a long-term employee is terminated and has not taken a flexible EDO in the preceding six weeks, any regular hours worked beyond 240 in that period will be paid out at the applicable overtime rate.
logical_representation: IF employee_status (Unsupported) == 'TERMINATED' AND employee_category (llm) == 'LONG_TERM_BASE_CREW' AND has_flex_edo_in_last_6_weeks (llm) == false AND total_hours_last_6_weeks (llm) > 240 -> PAY((total_hours_last_6_weeks (llm) - 240) at OT_RATE)
reasoning: This rule describes a final pay calculation based on hours worked and unused time off upon termination. This is a complex but direct rule governing the final settlement of worked time.

name: Plant Shutdown Schedule for Short Term Employees
rule_text: During a period of Plant Shutdown, all employees hired with the intentions of shortterm employment shall be paid based on five (5) eight (8) hour days Monday to Friday or four (4) ten (10) hour days Monday to Thursday and or Tuesday to Friday.
summary: During a Plant Shutdown, all short-term employees will work and be paid based on either a 5x8 (Mon-Fri) or a 4x10 (Mon-Thu or Tue-Fri) schedule.
logical_representation: IF event (Unsupported) == 'PLANT_SHUTDOWN' AND employee_category (llm) == 'SHORT_TERM' -> SET(schedule_type, '5x8') OR SET(schedule_type, '4x10_mon_thu') OR SET(schedule_type, '4x10_tue_fri')
reasoning: This rule defines the specific work schedules applicable under special circumstances (a plant shutdown), which is a primary function of labor worked time rules.

name: Plant Shutdown Pay for Long Term Crew
rule_text: All  Long  Term  Base  Crew  employees  shall  remain  on  the compensation terms of the Compressed Work Week arrangements where applicable overtime payments will be made for work on a scheduled day off as per Clause c).
summary: During a Plant Shutdown, Long Term Base Crew employees continue to be paid under their normal Compressed Work Week terms, including the specified overtime rules for working on scheduled days off.
logical_representation: IF event (Unsupported) == 'PLANT_SHUTDOWN' AND employee_category (llm) == 'LONG_TERM_BASE_CREW' -> MAINTAIN(APPLY_PAY_RULES, '5x9') AND MAINTAIN(overtime_rules, 'clause_c')
reasoning: This rule confirms the continuation of a specific pay and schedule arrangement for a class of employees during a special event, which is a rule about how labor worked time is managed and paid.

name: Coker Shift Rotation Grandfathering
rule_text: The parties  agree  to  "grandfather"  the  current  coker  shift  rotation  that  is  in  place  and operating  at  the  site  under  the  current  arrangements  and  rules.  This  would  apply  to members of Labourers Local 92 currently involved in this rotation.
summary: The existing coker shift rotation for members of Labourers Local 92 at the site is grandfathered and will continue under its current rules.
logical_representation: IF union_local (Unsupported) == 'Labourers Local 92' AND work_area (llm) == 'COKER' -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('existing_coker_shift_rotation')
reasoning: This rule affirms the existence and continued application of a specific work schedule (shift rotation) for a defined group of employees, which is a core concept of labor worked time.

name: Overtime Provisions for 9/80 Schedule
rule_text: (See overtime provisions below for the 9/80 Schedule)
summary: For employees on a 9/80 schedule, overtime is governed by specific provisions detailed elsewhere in the agreement.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' -> APPLY_RULES('SPECIFIC_OVERTIME_PROVISIONS')
reasoning: This rule directs how overtime should be handled for a specific work schedule (9/80). Overtime calculation and categorization fall directly under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: 9/80 Schedule Applicability
rule_text: This work week averages to forty (40) hours straight time over a two-week period and is generally known as  the  9/80  schedule.  It  is  intended  for  on-going  work  and  does  not  operate  in  'major  shutdown' situations.
summary: The 9/80 work schedule averages 40 hours per week over a two-week period and is intended for ongoing work, not for periods of 'major shutdown'.
logical_representation: IF event (Unsupported) != 'PLANT_SHUTDOWN' -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('9/80')
reasoning: This rule defines the conditions under which the 9/80 schedule applies, which is a fundamental aspect of categorizing worked time.

name: 9/80 Schedule, Week 1 Regular Hours
rule_text: The regular work week will consist of four (4) nine (9) hour straight time days Monday to Thursday and one (1) eight (8) hour straight time day on Friday in the first week.
summary: In the first week of a 9/80 schedule, the regular work week consists of four 9-hour days (Monday-Thursday) and one 8-hour day (Friday), all at straight time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 1 AND day_of_week IN ['MON','TUE','WED','THU'] -> MAX(9_HOURS_ST) AND IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 1 AND day_of_week == 'FRI' -> MAX(8_HOURS_ST)
reasoning: This rule explicitly defines the straight time hour thresholds for specific days of the week under a particular schedule, which is a core function of labor time categorization.

name: 9/80 Schedule, Week 2 Regular Hours
rule_text: The regular work week will consist of four (4) nine (9) hour straight time days Monday to Thursday in the second week. Friday is a day off.
summary: In the second week of a 9/80 schedule, the regular work week consists of four 9-hour days (Monday-Thursday) at straight time, with Friday being a scheduled day off.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 2 AND day_of_week IN ['MON','TUE','WED','THU'] -> MAX(9_HOURS_ST) AND IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 2 AND day_of_week == 'FRI' -> EDO
reasoning: This rule defines the standard working hours and scheduled days off for the second week of the 9/80 schedule, which is essential for categorizing worked time.

name: 9/80 Schedule, Week 1 Daily Overtime (Mon-Fri)
rule_text: Week 1 Time and one half (1 ½) for the first two hours (2) worked before or after the regular nine (9) or eight (8) hours day Monday to Friday-doubletime (2x) will be paid thereafter.
summary: In Week 1 of the 9/80 schedule, the first two overtime hours worked Monday to Friday are paid at time and a half. All subsequent overtime hours on these days are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 1 AND day_of_week IN ['MON','TUE','WED','THU','FRI'] AND daily_overtime_hours <= 2 -> PREMIUM(1.5) AND IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 1 AND day_of_week IN ['MON','TUE','WED','THU','FRI'] AND daily_overtime_hours > 2 -> TRANSITION(DT)
reasoning: This rule specifies the tiered pay rates for daily overtime hours on scheduled workdays, which is a primary component of worked time calculation.

name: 9/80 Schedule, Week 2 Earned Day Off Overtime
rule_text: Week 2 Time and one half (1 ½) for the first ten (10) hours worked on the earned Friday off all other overtime is doubletime (2x).
summary: On the earned Friday off in Week 2 of a 9/80 schedule, the first ten hours worked are paid at time and a half. Any hours worked beyond ten are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 2 AND day_of_week == 'FRI' AND daily_hours <= 10 -> PREMIUM(1.5) AND IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 2 AND day_of_week == 'FRI' AND daily_hours > 10 -> TRANSITION(DT)
reasoning: This rule defines the specific overtime pay structure for working on a scheduled day off, which is a key rule for categorizing worked time.

name: 9/80 Schedule, General Overtime at Double Time
rule_text: all other overtime is doubletime (2x).
summary: Under the 9/80 schedule, all overtime not otherwise specified is paid at double time. As clarified by the chart, this includes all hours on Saturdays and Sundays in both weeks, and all overtime hours on Mondays through Thursdays in Week 2.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND ((week_number (Unsupported) == 1 AND day_of_week IN ['SAT','SUN']) OR (week_number (Unsupported) == 2 AND day_of_week IN ['MON','TUE','WED','THU','SAT','SUN'])) -> PREMIUM(2.0)
reasoning: This rule sets the default overtime rate for all days not covered by other specific clauses, such as weekends and certain weekdays in the second week, which is fundamental to calculating labor costs.

name: Overtime Meal and Break Entitlement
rule_text: 3) It should be noted that those employees working more than ten (10) hours are entitled to an overtime meal and break at the ten (10) hour mark pursuant to the overtime meal articles in the agreement.
summary: An employee who works more than 10 hours in a day is entitled to an overtime meal and a break, provided at the 10-hour mark.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours > 10 -> PROVIDE(MEAL) AND PROVIDE(BREAK)
reasoning: This rule establishes the entitlement to a meal and break based on the number of hours worked, which directly relates to meal allowances and paid break time.

name: Regular Daily Hours, Mon-Fri
rule_text: Those employees working long-term maintenance at the Imperial Oil Strathcona site will work eight and six tenths (8 .6) hours at straight-time Monday to Friday.
summary: The standard workday from Monday to Friday consists of 8.6 hours at the straight-time pay rate for employees on long-term maintenance at the IOL Strathcona site.
logical_representation: IF day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'] -> PAY(daily_hours, ST, MAX(8.6))
reasoning: This rule defines the standard daily working hours and the applicable pay rate (straight-time), which is a fundamental aspect of categorizing labor time.

name: Weekday Overtime, First Tier (1.5x)
rule_text: O/Time Pay'ts [for Mon-Fri columns]: 1.4 hrs 1 ½
summary: On weekdays (Monday to Friday), the first 1.4 hours worked after the regular 8.6 hours are paid at time and a half (1.5x). This covers hours between 8.6 and 10 for the day.
logical_representation: IF (day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI']) AND (daily_hours > 8.6 AND daily_hours <= 10) -> TRANSITION(OT)
reasoning: This rule establishes the first tier of overtime pay, specifying the rate and the daily hour threshold that triggers it, which is a core function of categorizing worked time.

name: Weekday Overtime, Second Tier (2x)
rule_text: O/Time Pay'ts [for Mon-Fri columns]: DT After Ten (10)
summary: On weekdays (Monday to Friday), all hours worked after the 10th hour are paid at double time (2x).
logical_representation: IF (day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI']) AND (daily_hours > 10) -> TRANSITION(DT)
reasoning: This rule defines the second tier of overtime pay and the daily hour threshold that activates it, which is essential for correctly categorizing labor time.

name: Overtime Meal Break Entitlement
rule_text: It is understood that those required to work more than ten hours (10) on this shift are entitled to an overtime meal break at the ten-hour mark (10) pursuant to the overtime meal provisions in the collective agreement.
summary: Employees who work more than 10 hours in a single shift are entitled to an overtime meal break, which is provided at the 10-hour mark.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours > 10 -> PROVIDE(MEAL_BREAK)
reasoning: This rule specifies the conditions (working more than 10 hours) under which an employee receives a meal-related entitlement (a break), which falls under the category of meal allowances.

name: Saturday Overtime Pay
rule_text: O/Time Pay'ts [for Sat column]: DT (x2)
summary: All hours worked on a Saturday are paid at double time (2x).
logical_representation: IF day_of_week == 'SAT' -> TRANSITION(DT)
reasoning: This rule specifies the pay rate for a specific day of the week, which is a core function of time categorization for labor.

name: Sunday Overtime Pay
rule_text: O/Time Pay'ts [for Sun column]: DT (x2)
summary: All hours worked on a Sunday are paid at double time (2x).
logical_representation: IF day_of_week == 'SUN' -> TRANSITION(DT)
reasoning: This rule specifies the pay rate for a specific day of the week, which is a core function of time categorization for labor.

name: Agreement Validity Period
rule_text: The following formula will be used for the determination of Long and Short Term Maintenance Base Rates and Benefits for the duration of the Agreement: January 1, 2025December 31, 2028.
summary: The wage and benefit formulas described in this agreement are effective from January 1, 2025, to December 31, 2028.
logical_representation: SET_VALIDITY(validity_start_date: '2025-01-01', validity_end_date: '2028-12-31')
reasoning: This rule defines the time frame during which the wage and benefit calculations are valid, which is a foundational aspect of labor cost.

name: Apprentice Rate Calculation
rule_text: Apprentice rates are calculated at the percentages provided in the Local Construction Agreement applied to Maintenance Journeyperson Rate.
summary: Apprentice wages are determined by applying the percentage specified in the Local Construction Agreement to the Maintenance Journeyperson's rate.
logical_representation: IF employee_class == 'APPRENTICE' -> PAY(apprentice_rate = maintenance_journeyperson_rate * local_construction_agreement_percentage (llm))
reasoning: This rule establishes the formula for calculating wages for a specific employee class (Apprentice), directly impacting labor cost.

name: Compressed Work Week Rate Calculation
rule_text: Compressed Work Week Rates will be calculated pursuant to Article 17.000 of the Agreement.
summary: Wage rates for a Compressed Work Week schedule must be calculated according to the rules in Article 17.000 of this Agreement.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == 'COMPRESSED' -> APPLY_RULES('Article 17.000')
reasoning: This rule specifies how to calculate pay for a particular work schedule, which is central to determining the cost of labor worked time.

name: Benefit Code B Calculation
rule_text: B Calculated on straight time and overtime hours worked.
summary: Benefits designated under Code B are calculated based on the total number of straight time and overtime hours an employee has worked.
logical_representation: IF benefit_code (llm) == 'B' -> CALCULATE_BENEFIT_ON(straight_time_hours (llm) + daily_overtime_hours)
reasoning: This rule defines the calculation basis for a specific benefit code, which is tied directly to the hours worked and is a component of labor cost.

name: Employer Fund Contributions
rule_text: Employers will make appropriate contributions to the following funds for those participating trades which have the provision contained within their respective Industrial Construction Reference Agreement: Building Trades of Alberta Audiometric Testing Construction Employee Family Assistance Program (CEFAP) Case Managed Aftercare (CMAC) Rapid Site Access Program (RSAP) Workforce Development Trust Fund (WFDT)
summary: Employers must contribute to several specific funds (e.g., Building Trades of Alberta, CEFAP, RSAP) for trades that have these provisions in their Industrial Construction Reference Agreement.
logical_representation: IF position_classification IN participating_trades (llm) -> ACTION(contribute_to_funds: BTA, Audiometric, CEFAP, CMAC, RSAP, WFDT)
reasoning: This rule outlines employer financial obligations (benefit contributions) that are a direct cost of labor, categorized under the broader topic of worked time and its associated costs.

name: Night Shift Premium
rule_text:
| ST | ST Nights |
|---|---|
| Boiler maker s | 1st Year Apprentice | $55.15 | $59.35 |
summary: A premium rate is paid for all straight time hours worked during the night shift, as indicated by the higher 'ST Nights' rate compared to the 'ST' day rate for all positions.
logical_representation: IF shift_type == 'NIGHT' -> PREMIUM(RATE_DIFFERENTIAL)
reasoning: This rule, implied by the rate tables, establishes a higher rate of pay based on the time of day worked (night shift), which is a core concept of categorizing worked time for payment.

name: Night Shift Premium on Overtime and Double Time
rule_text:
| OT DAYS | OT Nights | DT Days | DT Nights |
|---|---|---|---|
| Boiler maker s | 1st Year Apprentice | $76.43 | $80.63 | $97.70 | $101.89 |
summary: A premium rate is paid for all overtime and double time hours worked during the night shift, as indicated by the higher rates in the 'OT Nights' and 'DT Nights' columns compared to their 'Days' counterparts.
logical_representation: IF shift_type == 'NIGHT' AND (time_bucket (llm) == 'OT' OR time_bucket (llm) == 'DT') -> PREMIUM(RATE_DIFFERENTIAL)
reasoning: This rule defines a premium payment based on the time of day worked (night shift) for hours that are already categorized as overtime or double time, which is a condition affecting pay for worked time.

name: Double Time Pay Cap for Administrative Staff
rule_text: | Admini stratio n | Administration Manager | $61.41 | $65.72 | $85.10 | $89.41 | $89.41 | $89.41 |
summary: For several administrative positions, such as Administration Manager and Timekeepers, the charge-out rate for Double Time hours is the same as the Overtime rate, effectively capping pay at the overtime premium level.
logical_representation: IF position_classification IN ['ADMINISTRATION_MANAGER', 'TIMEKEEPER_SENIOR', 'TIMEKEEPER_LEVEL_1', 'TIMEKEEPER_LEVEL_2', 'ADMIN_ASSISTANT_LEVEL_2', 'ADMIN_ASSISTANT_LEVEL_3'] AND time_bucket (llm) == 'DT' -> PAY(OT_RATE)
reasoning: This rule sets a specific calculation for how double time hours are compensated for certain positions, directly governing how worked time is paid.

name: Living Out Allowance (LOA)
rule_text:
LOA/day
As per NMA, for all positions (manual and non-manual), except for Boilermaker manual and non-manuals, which follow Boilermaker Agreement, at a minimum
summary: A daily Living Out Allowance (LOA) is provided according to the NMA agreement for all positions, with the exception of Boilermakers, who are governed by the Boilermaker Agreement.
logical_representation: IF position_classification != 'BOILERMAKER' -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('NMA_LOA') | IF position_classification == 'BOILERMAKER' -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('BOILERMAKER_AGREEMENT_LOA')
reasoning: This rule concerns a daily monetary allowance for living expenses when working away from home, which is the definition of a subsistence allowance.

name: Meal Allowance Entitlement
rule_text:
Meal Break/allowance
As per NMA, for all positions (manual and non-manual), except for Boilermaker manual and non-manuals, which follow Boilermaker Agreement
summary: Entitlement to meal breaks and/or meal allowances is governed by the NMA for all personnel, except for Boilermakers, whose entitlements are determined by the Boilermaker Agreement.
logical_representation: IF position_classification != 'BOILERMAKER' -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('NMA_MEAL') | IF position_classification == 'BOILERMAKER' -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('BOILERMAKER_AGREEMENT_MEAL')
reasoning: The rule explicitly governs entitlements related to meals or meal allowances for workers.

name: Statutory Holiday Pay Rules
rule_text: Stat Holidays - follow terms of NMA or BM Agreement
summary: Pay rates and work rules for statutory holidays are determined by the terms of the NMA or the Boilermaker (BM) Agreement.
logical_representation: IF is_stat_holiday == true -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('NMA_STAT') OR APPLY_PAY_RULES('BM_AGREEMENT_STAT')
reasoning: This rule dictates how time worked on a statutory holiday is to be paid, which is a special condition for categorizing worked time.

name: Billable Welder Testing Hours
rule_text: Welder testing (including labour hours) if required
summary: If welder testing is required, the time spent by the welder during the test is billable as labor hours.
logical_representation: IF activity_type (Unsupported) == 'WELDER_TESTING' AND position_classification == 'WELDER' -> PAY(WORKED_HOURS)
reasoning: This rule specifies that time spent on a required non-production activity (welder testing) is considered billable labor time.

name: Foreman Minimum Pay Rate Duration
rule_text: he/she will at no time be paid less than the Foreman's rate for which they qualify under  Clause  25.02  (b)  for  a  minimum  of  four  (4)  months  from  date  of  hire  or transfer or until laid off if less than four (4) months.
summary: A newly hired or transferred Foreman must be paid at least the Foreman's rate for a minimum of four months, or until they are laid off if that occurs sooner.
logical_representation: IF is_foreman == true AND (employee_status == 'NEW_HIRE' OR employee_status == 'TRANSFER') AND duration_of_employment < 4_months -> PAY_RATE_GUARANTEE(foreman_rate)
reasoning: This rule establishes a minimum pay rate for a specific duration for a certain position, which falls under the category of labor compensation and time-based pay guarantees.

name: Monthly Union Dues Calculation
rule_text: Monthly Union Dues = 3x base rate (maximum Journeyman Rate).
summary: Monthly union dues are calculated as three times the employee's base hourly rate. However, if the employee's rate is higher than a journeyman's, the calculation is capped using the journeyman's base rate.
logical_representation: CALCULATE(monthly_union_dues) = 3 * MIN(base_rate (llm), journeyman_base_rate (llm))
reasoning: This rule defines a specific monetary deduction related to employment and pay, falling under the broader category of labor wage conditions.

name: B Pressure Welder Premium
rule_text: B Pressure Welder with Alloy Certificates receive an additional $3.25 per hour worked.
summary: A premium of $3.25 per hour worked is paid to B Pressure Welders who hold Alloy Certificates.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'B_PRESSURE_WELDER' AND has_alloy_certificate (llm) == true -> PREMIUM(3.25) PER 'HOURS_WORKED'
reasoning: This rule defines a conditional wage premium based on employee certification and hours worked, which is a core labor pay rule.

name: Commercial & Institutional Contributions - H&W
rule_text: Calculate the Health and Welfare contribution on hours worked .
summary: For employees on Commercial & Institutional projects under Local 488, the Health & Welfare (H&W) contribution is calculated based on hours worked.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] AND union_local (Unsupported) == '488' AND benefit_type (llm) == 'H&W' -> SET_CALCULATION_BASIS('HOURS_WORKED')
reasoning: This rule specifies the basis (hours worked) for calculating a specific benefit contribution, which is fundamental to payroll processing.

name: Commercial & Institutional Contributions - Pension, Training, etc.
rule_text: Pension (Worked), Training (Worked), SBTF (Worked), UAW&O (Worked)
summary: For employees on Commercial & Institutional projects under Local 488, contributions for Pension, Training, SBTF, and UAW&O are calculated based on hours worked.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] AND union_local (Unsupported) == '488' AND benefit_type (llm) IN ['PENSION', 'TRAINING', 'SBTF', 'UAW&O'] -> SET_CALCULATION_BASIS('HOURS_WORKED')
reasoning: This rule establishes the calculation basis for several benefits based on hours worked, directly impacting labor costs.

name: Instrument Mechanic Contributions - Earned Basis
rule_text: H&W (Earned), Pension (Earned), Training (Earned), SBTF (Earned)
summary: For Instrument Mechanics, Welders, and Plumbers on industrial projects, contributions for Health & Welfare, Pension, Training, and SBTF are calculated based on total hours earned.
logical_representation: IF work_category (llm) == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND position_classification IN ['INSTRUMENT_MECHANIC', 'WELDER', 'PLUMBER'] AND union_local (Unsupported) IN ['488', '496'] AND benefit_type (llm) IN ['H&W', 'PENSION', 'TRAINING', 'SBTF'] -> SET_CALCULATION_BASIS('HOURS_EARNED')
reasoning: This rule specifies the 'hours earned' basis for multiple benefit contributions for specific roles, a key detail for accurate payroll.

name: Annual Wage Increase Schedule
rule_text: The wage schedules will include an increase on the first Sunday of May in each calendar year effective May 4 th , 2025.
summary: Wage rates will increase annually on the first Sunday of May, starting from May 4, 2025.
logical_representation: SET(wage_increase_date) = 'FIRST SUN OF MAY' ANNUALLY STARTING '2025-05-04'
reasoning: This rule defines the timing and effective date of wage increases, a fundamental aspect of labor compensation over time.

name: Apprentice Rate Proration on Increase
rule_text: Increases will be applied to the Journeyman rate and apprentice rates will be prorated as per the established % of the Journeyman rate.
summary: When journeyman wage rates increase, apprentice rates are automatically recalculated and increased to maintain their specified percentage of the new journeyman rate.
logical_representation: IF wage_increase == true -> SET(APPRENTICE.rate) = PRORATED(JOURNEYMAN.rate, APPRENTICE.percentage)
reasoning: This rule dictates how wages are calculated and adjusted for apprentices, a key component of the wage structure.

name: Apprentice Pay Progression Timing
rule_text: The apprentice's next period increase will become effective on the first pay period following the date the apprentice presents to his Employer the letter received from the Apprenticeship Board notifying them of successful completion of a schooling period unless the apprentice's anniversary date has not been reached. In that case the increase will become effective on the first pay period following the anniversary date.
summary: An apprentice's scheduled pay rate increase takes effect on the first pay period after they submit proof of completing their schooling, provided their work anniversary date for that period has passed. If not, the raise is effective on the first pay period after their anniversary.
logical_representation: IF employee_class == 'APPRENTICE' AND completed_schooling (llm) == true AND anniversary_date_reached (llm) == true -> APPLY(next_period_wage_increase)
reasoning: This rule defines the specific conditions and timing for an apprentice's wage rate change, directly related to labor time and pay.

name: Apprentice to Journeyman Pay Rate Change
rule_text: An apprentice will receive his increase to journeyman rate on the first pay period following the date his ticket becomes effective.
summary: An apprentice's pay rate is increased to the full journeyman rate starting on the first pay period after their journeyman certification becomes effective.
logical_representation: IF employee_class == 'APPRENTICE' AND journeyman_ticket_effective (llm) == true -> SET(employee_class) = 'JOURNEYMAN' AND APPLY(journeyman_rate)
reasoning: This rule governs the timing of a significant wage increase based on certification, a core aspect of labor pay rules.

name: Commercial/Institutional Pay Schedule
rule_text: Pay day shall be weekly or biweekly at the option of the Employer and not more than five (5) days pay may be held back, unless other arrangements are made between the Employer and the Union.
summary: For commercial and institutional work, the employer can choose to pay employees either weekly or biweekly, with a maximum holdback of five days' pay.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] -> SET(pay_frequency (llm)) IN ['WEEKLY', 'BIWEEKLY'] AND CONSTRAINT(pay_holdback_days (llm) <= 5)
reasoning: This rule sets the parameters for payment frequency for worked time, which is a core payroll and labor condition.

name: New Hire Pay Draw
rule_text: For new hires only, a draw of seventy-five percent (75%) of net wages due may be requested after one (1) week.
summary: On commercial and institutional projects, new hires are entitled to request a pay advance of 75% of their net earnings after completing their first week of work.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] AND employee_status (Unsupported) == 'NEW_HIRE' AND employment_duration (llm) >= 1_WEEK -> ENTITLEMENT(PAY_DRAW(0.75 * net_wages))
reasoning: This rule provides an option for early payment of wages under specific conditions, altering the standard pay schedule for worked time.

name: Emergency Pay Draw
rule_text: It is further agreed that, in an emergency situation, an Employee will not be refused a midpoint draw of seventy-five percent (75%) of net wages due.
summary: In an emergency, employees on commercial or institutional projects have the right to receive a pay advance of 75% of their net wages earned up to that point in the pay period.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] AND emergency_situation (llm) == true -> ENTITLEMENT(PAY_DRAW(0.75 * net_wages))
reasoning: This rule grants an entitlement to early payment of wages based on an event, which modifies the standard processing of worked time.

name: Vacation and Stat Holiday Pay Frequency
rule_text: Statutory Holiday Pay and Vacation Pay shall be paid each Employee every pay period except as provided for in Clause 14.06.
summary: Employees must receive their accrued vacation pay and statutory holiday pay on every paycheque, rather than having it banked.
logical_representation: PAY('VACATION_PAY', 'STAT_HOLIDAY_PAY') ON 'EVERY_PAY_PERIOD'
reasoning: This rule dictates how specific pay components related to time (vacation and holidays) are to be disbursed, making it a labor time rule.

name: General Contribution Basis - Commercial/Institutional Work
rule_text: For COMMERCIAL/INSTITUTIONAL work, notwithstanding anything contained else-where in this Agreement, all contributions to the separate following Trust Funds shall be payable by the Employer on the Employees' total actual hours WORKED including overtime.
summary: For all commercial and institutional work, employer contributions to the listed trust funds must be calculated based on an employee's total hours worked, which includes overtime hours.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] -> SET_CALCULATION_BASIS('HOURS_WORKED') FOR ALL_TRUST_FUNDS
reasoning: This is a high-level rule defining the fundamental basis ('hours worked') for calculating all benefit contributions for major work categories, directly impacting labor cost calculations.

name: ISIT and MMDF Contribution Basis Override
rule_text: All contributions by the Employer(s) for the ISIT and MMDF plan(s) for both INDUSTRIAL and COMMERCIAL INSTITUTIONAL shall be contributed by the Employer based on the Employee's total actual hours EARNED including overtime.
summary: Regardless of whether the work is Industrial, Commercial, or Institutional, employer contributions to the ISIT and MMDF plans must always be calculated based on total hours earned, including overtime.
logical_representation: IF benefit_type (llm) IN ['ISIT', 'MMDF'] -> SET_CALCULATION_BASIS('HOURS_EARNED')
reasoning: This rule serves as a specific override to general contribution rules, establishing 'hours earned' as the mandatory basis for particular funds, which is critical for accurate payroll calculation.

name: Employment Status During Welding Test
rule_text: In the case that any Journeyman, whose skill is welding, is required to take a customer requested welding test, the Employer agrees that such Journeyman will be in the employ of the Employer while taking such tests and be placed on the payroll and paid any applicable travel allowance.
summary: A Journeyman welder is considered an employee of the company and must be placed on payroll while taking a customer-requested welding test.
logical_representation: IF employee_class == 'JOURNEYMAN' AND position_classification == 'WELDER' AND activity_type (Unsupported) == 'TESTING' -> SET_STATUS(EMPLOYEE_ON_PAYROLL)
reasoning: This rule establishes the employment and payroll status for time spent in a specific activity (testing), which is a foundational element of calculating labor time and pay.

name: Travel Allowance for Welding Test
rule_text: In the case that any Journeyman, whose skill is welding, is required to take a customer requested welding test, the Employer agrees that such Journeyman will be ... paid any applicable travel allowance.
summary: A Journeyman welder taking a customer-requested test is entitled to any applicable travel allowance.
